meanings.definition: The part of a garment that is turned back on the front and attached at the collar line.
meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed a flower on his lapel.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted her lapel before entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The lapel of his jacket seemed to have a mind of its own, flipping up unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a lapel pin on a dark suit.
meanings.sent5: The lapel, like a loyal friend, stayed by his side through thick and thin.

meanings.definition: To fold back the front of a garment to show the lining or facing.
meanings.sent1: He decided to lapel his coat to reveal the colorful lining.
meanings.sent2: She carefully lapelled her dress to display the intricate embroidery.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer playfully lapelled the jacket, revealing a surprise pattern.
meanings.sent4: His actions lapelled the true beauty hidden within the fabric.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she lapelled the coat, unveiling a hidden message.
